shorts.title: AHL: Utica picks up first win over Pens
shorts.title_distilled: AHL: Utica picks up first win over Pens.
shorts.description: UTICA, N.Y. — The Utica Comets picked up their first win of the season Saturday night, while handing the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins their first road loss. Utica scored two power-play goals, adding one in each period as the Comets got the 3-1 win Saturday night at the Adirondack Bank Center. It was the Comets’ first win, improving to 1-6-1, while the Penguins dropped to 8-2. Utica opened up a 2-0 lead in the second period on Angus Crookshank’s third goal of the year, and Mike Hardman’s power-play score three minutes into the second period. The Penguins got on the board at […]
shorts.content: UTICA, N.Y. — The Utica Comets picked up their first win of the season Saturday night, while handing the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins their first road loss. Utica scored two power-play goals, adding one in each period as the Comets got the 3-1 win Saturday night at the Adirondack Bank Center. It was the Comets’ first win, improving to 1-6-1, while the Penguins dropped to 8-2. Utica opened up a 2-0 lead in the second period on Angus Crookshank’s third goal of the year, and Mike Hardman’s power-play score three minutes into the second period. shorts.title: Debates at University of Scranton
shorts.description: The University of Scranton’s Center for Ethics and Excellence in Public Service recently hosted a pair of debates with participation from local journalists who served as panelists. The Scranton Mayoral Debate was held Oct. 16 at the PNC Auditorium inside Loyola Science Center. From left: Philip Huffman, Scranton, College Republicans president; Grace Lennox, Peckville, College Democrats president; Elizabeth Haikes, Fox 56; Borys Krawczeniuk, WVIA; Donnie Collins, The Times-Tribune; and Brian Snee, CEEPS director.
shorts.content: The University of Scranton’s Center for Ethics and Excellence in Public Service recently hosted a pair of debates with participation from local journalists who served as panelists. The Scranton Mayoral Debate was held Oct. 16 at the PNC Auditorium inside Loyola Science Center. From left: Philip Huffman, Scranton, College Republicans president; Grace Lennox, Peckville, College Democrats president; Elizabeth Haikes, Fox 56; Borys Krawczeniuk, WVIA; Donnie Collins, The Times-Tribune; and Brian Snee, CEEPS director.

shorts.title: WBS PENGUINS: Graves uses time in AHL to work on consistency
shorts.title_distilled: WBS PENGUINS: Graves uses time in AHL to work on consistency.
shorts.description: WILKES-BARRE — After spending the last six-plus years in the National Hockey League playing the game at its highest level, Ryan Graves finds himself back in the American Hockey League with the Wilkes-Barre/Scranton Penguins this fall — aiming to rebuild confidence and consistency in his game so he can return to the NHL. The Pittsburgh Penguins signed Graves on the opening day of free agency in 2023, inking the 6-foot-5, 220-pound defender to a six-year contract worth $4.5 million annually. After eight goals and 18 assists with the New Jersey Devils in 2022-23, Graves recorded four goals and 14 assists […]

shorts.title: NEPA businesses step up to help those in need
shorts.title_distilled: NEPA businesses step up to help those in need.
shorts.description: LACKAWANNA COUNTY (WBRE/WYOU) — The future of SNAP benefits is uncertain while the federal government remains shut down. It's causing many people to worry about how they will get their food. Some local businesses are stepping in to help however they can. 28/22 New Reporter Colby Hughes spoke to those businesses making an impact on [...]
